DOC.brief_summary: A previous study find consumption high fat , low carbohydrate meal result increase feeling calmness , friendliness increase subjective energy level comparison low fat , high carbohydrate meal . The purpose study investigate whether high fat , low carbohydrate diet long duration ( 2 week ) enhance sustain change comparison low fat , high carbohydrate meal .
DOC.brief_title: The Effects Diet Mood , Cognition Appetite
DOC.detailed_description: Research show consume breakfast high either fat carbohydrate affect person memory , mood ability concentrate ( Benton & Parker , 1998 , Politt & Mathews , 1998 ) . Our previous study investigate effect high fat , low carbohydrate ( HFLC ) meal comparison low fat , high carbohydrate ( LFHC ) meal find HFLC meal result significantly increase feeling calmness , friendliness reduction feeling anger , increase subjective energy level comparison LFHC meal . However , chronic effect HFLC LFHC diet study . This purpose study investigate whether 2 week diet high either fat carbohydrate improve cognition/memory mood . It hypothesise prolonged feeding HFLC diet attenuate response see HFLC meal provide . Twenty healthy woman require attend School Biomedical Sciences seven occasion . The first visit involve screen test suitability inclusion study write , informed consent obtain . Weight , height blood pressure measure 5ml blood sample collect full blood count , urea , electrolytes random blood glucose assessment . Subjects ask complete questionnaire regard general health , eat habit , mood medical history . Following screen visit , subject ask record habitual food intake physical activity pattern 3 day period ( 2 weekday 1 weekend day . They attend laboratory 6 occasion , familiarisation visit 5 study visit . The familiarisation visit require ensure subject comfortable familiar use cognitive test administer . Subjects provide menu food consume even meal prior study visit , base 30 % total energy expenditure . This meal base food subject record complete food diary contain approximately 15 % total energy protein , 55 % carbohydrate 30 % fat . Before study visit subject instructed consume standardise meal last meal day 20.00 previous evening . After consumed meal instruct consume food drink apart water arrive lab . Subjects arrive ( fast ) lab 08.00 morning study visit . A cannula insert retrograde hand vein , prior infiltration insertion site 1 % lidocaine . The hand place heat box , remain throughout trial , obtain arterialised venous blood sample . The cannula keep patent slow infusion 0.9 % saline , sample take via three-way tap . Subjects either give HFLC , LFHC breakfast , order randomise . The HFLC breakfast provide study day HFLC diet intervention , LFHC breakfast provide study day LFHC diet intervention . Water freely available throughout day . Every 30 minute subject ask complete set visual analogue scale design assess subjective mood satiety , 15ml blood sample take measurement glucose , insulin , ghrelin , free fatty acid , glucagon , cholecystokinin ( CCK ) , Glucagon-like peptide 1 ( GLP-1 ) , cortisol , adrenaline noradrenaline . A 3ml sample take every 15minutes first 90 minute , analysis insulin glucose . A baseline sample triglyceride cholesterol take begin study visit . Cognitive test ( measure attention reaction time vigilance ) complete 0 , 45 , 90 135 minute minute provision breakfast . After 180 minute , cannula remove subject free leave lab . Subjects provide either HFLC diet LFHC diet consume 2 week . These diet design meet subject energy requirement . After consume diet 2 week ( diet comprise 3 meal 3 snack per day ) , subject return laboratory second study visit . Subjects provide set visual analogue scale complete day 4 , 8 12 intervention period . Subjects return habitual diet 2 week , complete second intervention . Subjects also ask come laboratory additional study visit either 2 day visit 1 two day visit 3 , consume habitual breakfast instead HFLC LFHC breakfast . During 2 week intervention period , subject ask consume food provide , drink , include alcohol caffeinated drink , may consume . If subject habitual tea/coffee drinker may consume maximum 3 cup tea/coffee day ( unsweetened , milk daily allocation ) ask maintain arm study .
DOC.criteria: female BMI 18.525kg/m2 age 1845 year regular breakfast eater regular menstrual cycle healthy Significant gastrointestinal disease , gastrointestinal surgery , diabetes significant major medical morbidity History significant eating disorder ( anorexia , bulimia ) Habitual dietary protein intake > 20 % total energy intake pregnancy breast feed anaemia ( Hb < 11.5g/dL ) random blood glucose concentration > 8mmol/l medication use contraception significant weight loss/gain ( > 14lb previous 3 month )
